Legal_Issue: Well-founded fear of persecution for a Convention reason
Outcome: Application granted, decision set aside, case remitted for rehearing
Credibility_Assessment: Board found lack of credible evidence; court found inadequate reasoning on credibility
Evidence_Type: Country condition reports, personal testimony, written letter
Basis_of_Claim: Political opinion, membership in particular social group
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Changes in country conditions, credibility of applicant
Application_Error: Failure to properly assess conflicting evidence, speculation on document authenticity
Review_Outcome: Decision remitted for rehearing by a differently constituted panel
Evidence_Ignored: Conflicting evidence regarding political climate in Ghana
Application_Factor: Perceived lack of credible evidence, alleged changes in Ghana's political situation
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Adequacy of reasons, credibility analysis, evaluation of country conditions
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule requiring assessment of whether changes in country conditions negate well-founded fear
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credible evidence, perceived change in country conditions
Evidentiary_Issues: Authenticity of letter, sufficiency of supporting documentation
Procedural_Fairness: Inadequate reasoning affecting fairness of decision
Credibility_Issues: Applicant's credibility questioned without sufficient justification
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on procedural unfairness and errors in law
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, sections related to refugee definition
